intro: Aegiphila fendleri, commonly known as the Desert Balm, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant has small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It is well adapted to hot, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities for its purported healing properties.
